title: uninstall should remove activated packages
body:
**Edit**.  Thank the gods for `grep -r`.  In my rampant testing of `flann`, I uninstalled versions that had already been `activate`d.  They remained in the respective `extensions.yaml` file of my python installations.  This means that any `activate` call will break for all.

The solution would be to `deactivate` by force when `uninstall` is performed, or maybe give a warning?  Feel free to close, I don't know if this is already known but probably is.  I thought the error was something else.

```console
sven:/opt/spack> mv var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/flann/ ~/Desktop/
sven:/opt/spack> spack activate /4ufq46n
==> Error: Spec b5rjo5qif5gs44ymukihkgmy2innvwcf not found in /opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora23-x86_64/gcc-5.3.1/flann-1.9.1-b5rjo5qif5gs44ymukihkgmy2innvwcf
sven:/opt/spack> spack reindex
sven:/opt/spack> spack find -lv py-numpy
==> 2 installed packages.
-- linux-fedora23-x86_64 / gcc@5.3.1 ----------------------------
4ufq46n py-numpy@1.12.1+blas+lapack  fgzexrq py-numpy@1.12.1+blas+lapack
sven:/opt/spack> spack info flann
==> Error: Package flann not found.
sven:/opt/spack> spack activate /4ufq46n
==> Error: Spec b5rjo5qif5gs44ymukihkgmy2innvwcf not found in /opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora23-x86_64/gcc-5.3.1/flann-1.9.1-b5rjo5qif5gs44ymukihkgmy2innvwcf
sven:/opt/spack> grep 'flann' opt/spack/.spack-db/
index.json   lock         prefix_lock  
sven:/opt/spack> grep 'flann' opt/spack/.spack-db/index.json 
sven:/opt/spack> echo ":'("
:'(
```

**How does activate know about `flann`**?  That particular `py-numpy` came from a `flann` installation, but I moved the `flann` package out of the working tree. [i'm packaging flann right now, removed links since no longer relevant]
